employment.title: Lifehope Systems Administrator and Dancelink Ministry
responsibilities: As a Systems Administrator I have been heavily involved in both the management and development of the systems we use. While I work with another Sysadm in the Birmingham Lifehope office, I am solely responsible for the other Lifehope facility in London.
In dance ministry I work alongside the Lifehope Dancelink director to teach dance and theology of arts. We use dance as a form of evangelism, intercession, and worship.

employment.title: Intern - Software Developer
responsibilities: I independently maintained their entire server infrastructure.
I developed new systems that facilitate their ability to see and communicate with their customers worldwide.

employment.title: Computing Services Work Study
responsibilities: I fixed software and hardware problems with student computers and the college computers around campus.
Assisted with the installation of the phone system and the refactoring of the network currently in use at NWC.

employment.title: Technology Coordinator
responsibilities: Attended to problems on the network such as filtering and outages.
Managed (setup, tear down, and running) all of the audio/video equipment that were used for camp activities, worship, family reunions and more.
Served as a counselor for Elementary, Junior High, and Senior High camps.

employment.title: Software Developer and General IT
responsibilities: Developed software to be used as an inventory tracking system.
Assisted in the selection of hardware and systems for warehouse management.
Designed and created layout and schema for barcodes throughout the warehouse.
Assisted in the managing of various IT related issues.

skills.title: Software Development
content: Created a program for distributing compute-intensive programs across a network that could scale to hundreds of machines while having a minimal footprint on the client machines.

Contributed to the open source project Salt for several of the project’s Windows modules. Most notably I wrote the module for managing the Windows Update Agent which David Boucha, Senior Software Engineer for Salt, decided to incorporate into the mainline Salt project.

Developed a service for my employer Ozone Solutions that would synchronize all of their client information between their various account management systems as well as create a weighted map of the locations of their clients worldwide.

skills.title: Mentoring
content: Completed the Operation Mobilization Mentoring Clinic and received certificate of achievement.
Learned to establish rapport with students/protégés.
Learned various methods for determining where a protégé is struggling how best to free them to be able to thrive in academic, personal, and practical realms.

skills.title: Performing Arts
content: Instructor and choreographer for OM-Arts International Incarnate program for developing artists learning to use their art form in faith and Christian mission.
Performed with OM-Arts in Bobbio Italy, 2014.
Worked in capacities as an actor, stage manager, writer, master electrician, and/or director for several plays in high school and college.
Nominated for Irene Ryan Acting Scholarship Competition, Kennedy Center American College Theater Festival 2013.
Performed as a member of the Northwestern Symphonic Band for all four years of my collegiate career.
Performed as a member of the Northwestern A Capella Choir for 2 years.

volunteering: Counselor for seven years at the local Christian camp for day camp, elementary, and Junior high camps.
Ran sound equipment for each church I have regularly attended.
Participated as a musician in my church during high school and current church in the UK.
I worked with the Catholic Social Services mental health team during disaster relief after the tornado in Parkersburg, IA.
I was an assistant teacher at Pomeroy-Palmer High School teaching fundamental electronics.
